subject: p17962324
Findings: An opacity at the base of the right lung is not similar in appearance to chest radiograph on and may represent overlapping structures. However, an opacity in the retrocardiac clear space on the left is new. Additionally, there is an opacity at the left posterior costophrenic The cardiomediastinal silhouette and hilar contours are normal. There is no pneumothorax. Sternotomy wires and surgical clips are again seen and not significantly changed in appearance.
Impression: Left basilar opacity which could be compatible with infection. Recommend repeat imaging after treatment. If no clincal concern for infection, consider chest CT for further evaluation.
